Name: treatment of slaughterhouse waste, rendering | meat and bone meal | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/101:Processing and preserving of meat/1010:Processing and preserving of meat
Description: Refers to a typical technology for tallow processing in Switzerland. The tallow-production process is described as follows: The animal carcasses and abattoir wastes are crushed in a grinder, then sterilised by steam. They are then dried using steam as a heat source, and finally defatted, a process in which the fat is separated from the greaves. The fat is clarified, while the greaves are milled into meat- and bone meal. The processing paths of tallow and of meat- and bone meal are very similar, diverging only in the final step (milling). The minimum requirements for sterilisation are a temperature of 133 °C and a pressure of 3 bar for 20 minutes (Nottrodt 2001). ;References;Kleinhanss W., Uhlmann F. & Haxsen G.
